page.title: 04FROYLE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {Froyle Primary School was built by Sir {Hubert Miller,}the Lord of the Manor, in 1867, before education was compulsory and it has had up to 150 children at times in the past. In recent years the population in the village has dropped and the school now only has 25 pupils.{ The Hampshire {authority propose its closure in {1986} with the children transferring to Bentley School nearby.{ The {building is beautiful,}of local malm-stone (Froyle is on the edge of chalk land and river gravels). The adjacent school house (no longer lived in by the school's head teacher) was the last building in the village to be built with stone quarried locally.
